image.altText: A bald police officer speaks at a podium.

props.synopsis: Police will withdraw charges against an ex-immigration detainee accused of sex offences after reviewing CCTV footage.

title.children: Police drop sex offence charges against released immigration detainee — as it happened

image.altText: Villawood Immigration Detention Centre

props.synopsis: A former immigration detainee has had sex offence charges against him dropped, after being wrongly identified as being involved in two assaults in Melbourne.

title.children: Ex-detainee has sex offence charges dropped in police bungle

image.altText: Mike Burgess, with a beard and wearing a suit and purple tie, sitting in front of a microphone

props.synopsis: After the spy news broke, Thursday morning in Parliament House was pleasantly given over to a Cluedo-type game as politicians searched for one of their own, write Annabel Crabb and Brett Worthington.

title.children: Giant game of Cluedo breaks out in halls of democracy after spook spills beans

image.altText: A man with his back to camera facing out of a large window.

props.synopsis: Australia's domestic spy agency has revealed a retired politician betrayed the nation, but stopped short of naming them. Here's what we know, and what might happen next.

title.children: Revelations of a 'traitor' politician have sent a rocket up parliament. Here's what we know

image.altText: Man wearing a hard hat and high-vis vest standing in front of a building.

props.synopsis: NSW Building Commissioner David Chandler has ordered construction cease on a dual-tower, 149-unit apartment block in the heart of Wollongong after the detection of serious structural defects.

title.children: 'Not going to sleepwalk into this bloody tragedy': Work halts on 16-storey apartment block in Wollongong CBD

image.altText: A smiling man in a cap.

props.synopsis: An Indigenous man who died after being misdiagnosed at Dubbo hospital wrote to a relative he feared going to hospitals, an inquest has heard.

title.children: Indigenous culture 'completely misunderstood', inquest hears, as late dad's fear of hospital revealed

image.altText: Celeste Manno.

props.synopsis: A man who obsessively stalked and then killed his former coworker will not be eligible for parole until 2050.

title.children: Luay Sako sentenced to 36 years behind bars over murder of Melbourne woman Celeste Manno

image.altText: A rainbow flag waves on the sidelines.

props.synopsis: A NSW Central West councillor wants the event cancelled because 'council is not responsible for gender and sexuality'.

title.children: Call to cancel inaugural Mardi Gras festival in regional town 'disgusting'

image.altText: A group of police officers outside a building

props.synopsis: Lawyer Van Cooney was taken to hospital on Wednesday after being shot on the ninth floor of a building in Castlereagh Street.

title.children: Man charged over Sydney CBD shooting armed with pistol and sawn-off semi-automatic rifle, court documents say

image.altText: A woman with black hair in a white dress speaking to a group of microphones in front of a grass patch and group of buildings

props.synopsis: The mayor of a regional council says he is very concerned about the future of a mould-infested high school in the city after being unable to secure a meeting with the NSW education minister during her visit to the community.

title.children: Government promises consultation on Broken Hill school at risk of demolition due to mould

image.altText: The outside of the Toowoomba Court

props.synopsis: The man, who the court heard considered himself "the worst kind of feral pig there is", started abusing his daughter when she was aged four. She was 15 when it ended.

title.children: Queensland man jailed after raping own daughter 'every second day' for 11 years

image.altText: Flames and smokes visible behind trees of a suburban backyard with shed, swing, clothesline, lights.

props.synopsis: Fire authorities are warning people of the dangers of leaving evaporative air-conditioners turned on during a fire after drifting embers sparked a fire in the roof of a house.

title.children: House destroyed after air conditioning unit sucks in embers, as police investigate fires in south west WA

image.altText: Two Palestinian boys play next to to Jewish girls at lunchtime in the school yard.

props.synopsis: Known in Arabic as Wahat al-Salaam and in Hebrew as Neve Shalom, Israel's only community shared intentionally between Jews and Palestinians hopes to show the wider world that a shared society is possible.

title.children: Inside 'the dream' where Israelis and Palestinians live together harmoniously, even as war rages on

image.altText: Medium close up of woman wearing white shirt looking into camera with a half-smile on her face.

props.synopsis: Marion Barter's disappearance has been a mystery for nearly 27 years. After a lengthy and complex investigation, findings from a coronial inquest are handed down this morning.

title.children: Mother who changed name, travelled to UK with lover and disappeared in 1997 is dead, coroner says

image.altText: Aerial view of a coal mine with a pile of black coal.

props.synopsis: Miner South32 signals a further transition to a low-carbon business announcing plans to sell Illawarra Metallurgical Coal to an Asian-based resources company.

title.children: South32 to divest itself of Illawarra coal, but the $2.5b deal must be approved by BlueScope

image.altText: A man and woman look at each other with the blue mountains in the background

props.synopsis: Paul and Julia Bamforth will spend decades behind bars after sexually abusing a child in their Narara home over a five-year period.

title.children: Married NSW couple receive 30-year sentences after lengthy abuse of a child with cognitive impairment

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Philippines President Ferdinand Marcos Jr shake hands after holding a press conference at Parliament House.

props.synopsis: In a speech to parliament in Canberra, Ferdinand Marcos Jr spruiks expanding military ties with Australia, earning praise from Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton as Greens boycott his address.

title.children: Albanese, Dutton united in praise for visiting Philippines leader, but Greens senators boycott speech to parliament

image.altText: An image of Wang Yi and Penny Wong

props.synopsis: Details and dates are still to be determined and announced, but experts say a range of thorny issues could be on the table.

title.children: 'A lot of contentious issues on the agenda': Australia and China preparing for high-level talks

image.altText: A police officer with a torch.

props.synopsis: It's never been easier to buy convincing fake luxury fashion online. But many buyers would be shocked to learn where their money goes.

title.children: It's so profitable, even the cop stamping it out admits this is 'the crime I'd get into'

image.altText: A group of people pose for a photo.

props.synopsis: Muslim community leaders have welcomed the cancellation of the Victorian premier's annual Iftar dinner, after several groups threatened to boycott the event over the way Labor has responded to the Israel-Gaza war.

title.children: The Victorian government's annual Iftar dinner has been cancelled following backlash

image.altText: Cameron Green celebrates

props.synopsis: A Cameron Green century rescues Australia on a tough day one of the first Test against New Zealand in Wellington, with the tourists closing play at 9-279.

title.children: Green makes important century to steady Australia on day one of first Test against New Zealand

image.altText: A man with grey hair wearing a suit stands for the camera.

props.synopsis: A former politician was cultivated by spies, Australian intelligence has revealed, and former treasurer Joe Hockey says every politician's loyalty will be questioned until that "traitor" is named.

title.children: Unnamed 'traitor' politician cultivated by spies puts loyalty of all politicians in question, says former treasurer

props.synopsis: The owners of the Crooked House, which was demolished after a fire gutted it last year, have been ordered to rebuild it, but can it be returned to its former glory?

title.children: English council's demand for rebuild of 200-year-old wonky pub could do 'more damage than good'

image.altText: Olivia Rodrigo holding up a megaphone on stage, mouth open, white shirt, microphone inside glitter briefs

props.synopsis: America's National Network of Abortion Funds has welcomed support from Grammy-winner Olivia Rodrigo, saying supporting abortion funds "has never been more critical".

title.children: Olivia Rodrigo pledges tour funds to support reproductive rights before heading to key abortion battleground

image.altText: A man wearing cap and black Tshirt sits at a table with a small camera on a tripod in front of him

props.synopsis: Young people in Japan are leaving for Australia in droves, as the local economy enters recession and cost of living rises out of step with wages.

title.children: Shoma moved from Japan to Sydney for a working holiday, but instead he found a financial bonanza

image.altText: A police car and a footpath.

props.synopsis: A 15-year-old boy is sentenced to three years in juvenile detention after sparking fears of an American-style school shooting in Australia when he fired gunshots at a Perth school, later telling a triple-0 operator he had planned to kill people but changed his mind.

title.children: Teen jailed for Perth school shooting which left staff and students terrified

image.altText: Daria Saville pumps her left fist during a match in San Diego.

props.synopsis: Daria Saville fights back from a set down to progress to her first WTA 500 quarterfinal since 2022, while defending champion Alex de Minaur marches into the last eight in Acapulco.

title.children: Saville saves match point to advance in San Diego, de Minaur's Acapulco defence stays alive

image.altText: An illustration of a wind farm and a solar farm with an hour glass in the middle.

props.synopsis: New South Wales is regarded as "the most difficult state" for clean energy developers, according to fresh analysis which found the state is taking roughly 3,488 days to rubber stamp a wind farm.

title.children: Australia has six years to clean up its power grid. But in one state, it's taking nearly 10 years to approve a wind farm

image.altText: Rolfe 2

props.synopsis: NT Police tells the coroner it rejects Zachary Rolfe's evidence that a specialist policing unit would issue an award with a racist name, after the coroner hears Mr Rolfe hadn't disclosed to his superiors he was taking medication the night he fatally shot Kumanjayi Walker.

title.children: NT Police refutes Rolfe's evidence of racism in force at Walker inquest

image.altText: Di Sanh Duong wearing a suit and glasses.

props.synopsis: Melbourne businessman Di Sanh Duong, 68, will face at least a year in jail after being found guilty of attempting to politically influence former federal minister Alan Tudge.

title.children: Chinese-Australian businessman jailed over attempt to influence federal MP

image.altText: Virgin cruise ship docked in Hobart emitting fumes

props.synopsis: The Resilient Lady is a billion-dollar ship that has been offering adult-only cruises in Australia this summer. But its visits to Hobart have left residents concerned about the plumes of smoke belching from its funnels.

title.children: 'Disgusting' emissions prompt Virgin Voyages to make changes to cruise ship fuel after backlash in Hobart
